required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Second Generation LMA Versus Endotracheal Tube in Obese Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of a Second-Generation Laryngeal Mask Airway Versus Endotracheal Tube in Obese Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

clinical_study.source: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective, randomized, comparative study is intended to enroll a total of 148 patients with a BMI 30-49.9 kg/m2 undergoing surgery at Parkland Hospital. The efficacy and performance of a second-generation LMA will be compared to endotracheal intubation. A standardized anesthetic protocol that is usual and customary for the type of operation the patient is having will be provided to the anesthesia teams of enrolled subjects. The remainder of the anesthetic care of the subject will not deviate from the standard of care.

primary_outcome.description: Patients in the 2 groups will be assessed for postoperative hypoxia in the PACU using a visual analog scale.

secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure monitor readings will be recorded throughout the surgery and compared to baseline pre-operative values.
Heart rate monitor readings will be recorded throughout the surgery and compared to baseline pre-operative values.
Oxygen saturation readings will be recorded throughout the surgery and compared to baseline pre-operative values.
Respiratory rate readings will be recorded throughout the surgery and compared to baseline pre-operative values.

intervention.description: A second-generation LMA will be used for airway management (instead of ETT).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-80 years old
- Obese (BMI > or equal to 30 kg/m2
- Scheduled for a non-emergent surgery that requires general anesthesia (e.g., orthopedic, breast, urological, colorectal, ENT, vascular, general surgery)
- Willing and able to consent in English or Spanish
- No current history of advanced pulmonary or cardiac disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 18 or older than 80
- BMI â‰¥50 or < 30 kg/m2
- Patient does not speak English or Spanish
- Expected surgical duration longer than 4 hours
- Planned postoperative ICU admission
- Patient refusal
- Monitored anesthesia care (MAC) or regional anesthesia planned
- Pregnant or nursing women
- "Stat" (emergent) cases
- Known or suspected difficult airway
- Full stomach/significant aspiration risk (gastroparesis, emergency surgery, untreated moderate to severe gastroesophageal reflux disease, hiatal hernia)
- No history of gastric surgery
- Surgery in position other than supine (e.g., Trendelenburg)
- Laparoscopic surgery

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center
